interface.name: MultivariateInterpolator
interface.javadoc:
Interface representing a univariate real interpolating function.
2.1
$Id: MultivariateInterpolator.java 1455194 2013-03-11 15:45:54Z luc $

Computes an interpolating function for the data set.
xval the arguments for the interpolation points.{@code xval[i][0]} is the first component of interpolation point{@code i}, {@code xval[i][1]} is the second component, and so on until {@code xval[i][d-1]}, the last component of that interpolation point (where {@code d} is thus the dimension of the space).
yval the values for the interpolation points
a function which interpolates the data set
MathIllegalArgumentException if the arguments violate assumptions made by the interpolation algorithm.
DimensionMismatchException when the array dimensions are not consistent.
NoDataException if an array has zero-length.
NullArgumentException if the arguments are {@code null}.
